content: --वेद {%<ab>a.</ab>%} not acknowledging the Vedas, an atheist, infidel.

निर्वेदः {@--1@} Disgust, loathing. {@--2@} Satiety, cloy. {@--3@} Depression of spirits, despair, despondency; परिभवान्निर्वेदमापद्यते <ls>Mk. 1. 14.</ls> {@--4@} Humiliation. {@--5@} Grief. {@--6@} Complete indifference to worldly objects; <ls>Bg. 2. 52</ls> regarded as the feeling which gives rise to the sentiment called शांत (quietude); निर्वेदस्थायिभावोस्ति शांतोऽपि नवमो रसः <ls>K. P. 4</ls>; (see <ls>R. G.</ls> under निर्वेद). {@--7@} Selfdisparagement or humiliation (regarded as one of the 33 subordinate feelings); <ab>cf.</ab> the definition in <ls>R. G.</ls> under निर्वेद; (the following is there given as an instance; यदि लक्ष्पण सा मृगेक्षणा न मदीक्षासरणिं समेष्यति . अमुना जडजीवितेन मे जगता वा विफलेन किं फलं ..). {@--8@} Shame.
